benchmark_details.name: Noise, Adaptation, and Strategy: Assessing LLM Fidelity in Decision-Making
benchmark_details.overview: We propose a process-oriented evaluation framework with progressive interventions to examine how LLM agents adapt under different levels of external guidance and human-derived noise, using two classic economics tasks to validate the framework.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the behavioral fidelity of LLM agents in dynamic decision-making tasks.

data.source: Behavioral data from classic economics tasks validated in controlled settings.

methodology.calculation: Kolmogorovâ€“Smirnov distance and entropy metrics for behavior similarity and variability.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ratings indicate greater alignment with human decision-making patterns.
methodology.baseline_results: LLM agents generally exhibit low-variance decision-making compared to human variability.
methodology.validation: Experimentation across multiple iterations and conditions to ensure reliability.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Human data used obtained under prior IRB approval.
